name: Helping Hand for Relief and Development
mission: Helping Hand for Relief and Development is a global humanitarian relief and development organization responding to human sufferings in emergency and disastrous situations anywhere all over the world regardless race, gender, ethnicity, class, location, religion, color, cultural diversity and social background; with special focus on countries where the massive population is living below the poverty line. In addition to our emergency relief efforts in natural or man made disaster areas, we also work on long term relief and development programs like livelihood, economic empowerment, orphan and widows support program and skill development program.
theoryOfChange: HHRD aims to move people from immediate relief to self-sufficiency through education, skills training, and sustainable infrastructure.
zakatClaimEvidence: HHRD Recognized Amongst Top Zakat Charity. HHRD's philanthropic programs have not gone unnoticed, we are ranked among the top-rated Zakat Eligible Charity in the USA. Offer Your Zakat Today. Zakat given to Helping Hand USA is distributed to those who need it most, in accordance with Islamic guidelines, and funds to support numerous projects worldwide. (Source: https://hhrd.org/auditReport/2020_990.pdf)

The organization is dedicated to providing immediate disaster response and long-term developmental programs, particularly focusing on orphan care, skills development, and healthcare. Operating across multiple regions including Pakistan, Jordan, and Haiti, HHRD has established itself as a major player in international relief. The organization demonstrates exceptional financial health, maintaining an <cite id="1">overall score of 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. In its most recent fiscal year, HHRD reported <cite id="2">$94,048,415 in total revenue</cite>, directing a highly efficient <cite id="2">90.2% to program expenses</cite>. This efficiency is further highlighted by its fundraising metrics, spending just <cite id="1">$0.06 per $1 raised</cite>. The charity is fully <cite id="12">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting critical humanitarian interventions. With a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 8.2%</cite>, HHRD shows steady, sustainable growth, supported by <cite id="1">10.4 months of working capital</cite> to ensure resilience during global crises.
